intro: Haemodorum discolor, commonly known as the red-stemmed hellbore, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as the "red gums." The plant is characterized by its striking red stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces bright orange to red flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Haemodorum discolor is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys.
